verses.kjv: After this opened Job his mouth, and cursed his day.
verses.ct: After this, Job finally spoke up and cursed the day he was born.

verses.kjv: And Job spake, and said,
verses.ct: Job said:

verses.kjv: Let the day perish wherein I was born, and the night in which it was said, There is a man child conceived.
verses.ct: "Let the day I was born be wiped out, and the night someone announced, 'A boy has been conceived!'

verses.kjv: Let that day be darkness; let not God regard it from above, neither let the light shine upon it.
verses.ct: Let that day turn to darkness. Let God above not care about it, and let no light reach it.

verses.kjv: Let darkness and the shadow of death stain it; let a cloud dwell upon it; let the blackness of the day terrify it.
verses.ct: Let deep darkness and the shadow of death reclaim it. Let thick clouds settle over it, and let everything that darkens the day overwhelm it.

verses.kjv: As for that night, let darkness seize upon it; let it not be joined unto the days of the year, let it not come into the number of the months.
verses.ct: As for that night — let total darkness swallow it up. Let it never be counted among the days of the year or included in any month.

verses.kjv: Lo, let that night be solitary, let no joyful voice come therein.
verses.ct: Let that night be empty and barren. Let no sound of joy ever be heard in it.

verses.kjv: Let them curse it that curse the day, who are ready to raise up their mourning.
verses.ct: Let those who curse unlucky days pronounce their curse on it — those who are skilled at stirring up Leviathan.

verses.kjv: Let the stars of the twilight thereof be dark; let it look for light, but have none; neither let it see the dawning of the day:
verses.ct: Let its morning stars stay dark. Let it wait for daylight that never comes, and never see the first rays of dawn —

verses.kjv: Because it shut not up the doors of my mother’s womb, nor hid sorrow from mine eyes.
verses.ct: because it didn't shut the doors of my mother's womb or keep me from seeing all this suffering.

verses.kjv: Why died I not from the womb? why did I not give up the ghost when I came out of the belly?
verses.ct: Why didn't I die at birth? Why didn't I take my last breath the moment I came into the world?

verses.kjv: Why did the knees prevent me? or why the breasts that I should suck?
verses.ct: Why were there knees to hold me, or breasts to nurse me?

verses.kjv: For now should I have lain still and been quiet, I should have slept: then had I been at rest,
verses.ct: If I had died then, I would be lying still and at peace. I would be sleeping, finally resting —

verses.kjv: With kings and counsellors of the earth, which built desolate places for themselves;
verses.ct: alongside kings and advisors of the earth who built grand monuments for themselves,

verses.kjv: Or with princes that had gold, who filled their houses with silver:
verses.ct: or alongside rulers who had gold and filled their palaces with silver.

verses.kjv: Or as an hidden untimely birth I had not been; as infants which never saw light.
verses.ct: Or why wasn't I like a stillborn child, hidden away — like babies who never saw the light of day?

verses.kjv: There the wicked cease from troubling; and there the weary be at rest.
verses.ct: In death, the wicked stop causing trouble, and the exhausted finally find rest.

verses.kjv: There the prisoners rest together; they hear not the voice of the oppressor.
verses.ct: There, prisoners are at ease together; they no longer hear the shouts of their slave drivers.

verses.kjv: The small and great are there; and the servant is free from his master.
verses.ct: The lowly and the powerful are both there, and the slave is finally free from his master.

verses.kjv: Wherefore is light given to him that is in misery, and life unto the bitter in soul;
verses.ct: Why does God give light to someone drowning in misery, and life to those whose souls are filled with bitterness —

verses.kjv: Which long for death, but it cometh not; and dig for it more than for hid treasures;
verses.ct: people who long for death but it doesn't come, who search for it more desperately than for buried treasure,

verses.kjv: Which rejoice exceedingly, and are glad, when they can find the grave?
verses.ct: who would celebrate with overwhelming joy if they could reach the grave?

verses.kjv: Why is light given to a man whose way is hid, and whom God hath hedged in?
verses.ct: Why give light to someone whose path is blocked, someone God has fenced in on every side?

verses.kjv: For my sighing cometh before I eat, and my roarings are poured out like the waters.
verses.ct: My groaning comes instead of food, and my cries pour out like water.

verses.kjv: For the thing which I greatly feared is come upon me, and that which I was afraid of is come unto me.
verses.ct: The very thing I dreaded most has happened to me; what I was terrified of has come crashing down on me.

verses.kjv: I was not in safety, neither had I rest, neither was I quiet; yet trouble came.
verses.ct: I have no peace, no rest, no calm — only endless turmoil."
